concern: This is a really niche major but would you advise for or against majoring in packaging engineering (or I guess just industrial technology). I have never been the greatest at math but at the same time never applied myself and truly put effort into it. It’s a really advanced curriculum and although I’ve always exceeded academically with low effort it’s still really intimidating. The thing is with most other majors I have absolutely no interest in and I want other options from getting a bachelors aswell (land surveying, law, med and general education for the resume). I know that the work and effort aside this is what I want but also am tempted to choose an easier major like supply chain management which I’m less interested in but has great pay and is relatively easy. Also considering taking the exact opposite route with film that I’m pretty interested in and has surprisingly good opportunities in freelance especially but pays significantly less and I don’t think I want to do this for more then a side hustle freelance. Is there any free online math course I could do to test my math skills when I give it my all? Or do you have any other advice on the major/question

dialogue_total.statement: Hey there! What's on your mind today? I'm all ears well, figurative ears since I'm an AI .

I'm feeling really unsure about choosing the right college major, especially with one that excites me but feels intimidating due to my skills. I'm weighing options that might be easier or more practical, and I'm wondering if I can improve in areas like math to make a better decision.
It sounds like youre torn between passion and practicality. Whats the major that excites you, if you dont mind me asking?
The major that excites me is packaging engineering. I'm drawn to it because it aligns with my interests, but I'm concerned about the challenges it presents with my skills.

Packaging engineeringthats a fascinating field! It's great that youre considering a major that aligns with your interests, but I can understand your concern about the challenges it might present. What skills are you worried about specifically?

I'm specifically worried about my math skills, as the advanced curriculum in packaging engineering feels intimidating and I'm not confident in that area despite my academic history. That said, I'm eager to explore if I can improve to pursue what truly interests me.

Your determination to explore ways to improve your math skills and pursue your passion is admirable. It's true that some subjects can be daunting, but with hard work and dedication, you can overcome those challenges. Have you considered seeking additional resources like tutoring, online courses, or study groups to help boost your confidence in math?

Yes, I've considered options like free online math courses, such as those on Khan Academy, to test my abilities and see if I can build the skills needed for my preferred major. I'm also open to exploring tutoring or study groups to help me overcome these challenges while staying true to what excites me academically.

That's a great plan! Khan Academy is an excellent resource, and its awesome that youre willing to explore other options too. By dedicating time to improving your math skills, youre giving yourself the best chance to pursue packaging engineering. Plus, theres something really empowering about facing your fears and pushing yourself outside of your comfort zone.

Thanks for the encouragementit really helps me feel more motivated to tackle my challenges. I'm eager to start with those resources like Khan Academy and see if building my skills aligns with pursuing what truly interests me.

You've got this! Remember, the journey to success often involves facing challenges and overcoming obstacles. You're taking a huge step by exploring ways to improve your math skills, and that's something to be proud of. I'm rooting for you!

Thanks for your supportit means a lot and motivates me to keep pushing forward with my skills. I'm feeling more confident about exploring those resources to see if I can balance my interests with the challenges ahead.
